case_vignette:
A 2-week-old female newborn is brought to the physician because of increasing yellow discoloration of her eyes and skin for 2 days. She was born at 39 weeks' gestation and weighed 3066 g (6 lb 12 oz); she now weighs 3200 g (7 lb 1 oz). She is exclusively breastfed. Her older brother died 3 months after liver surgery. Her temperature is 37.1°C (98.8°F), pulse is 145/min, and respirations are 40/min. Examination shows yellow discoloration extending to the palms and soles. The liver is palpated 1 cm below the right costal margin. Laboratory studies show:
Hematocrit 51%
Serum
Bilirubin
Total 16.1 mg/dL
Direct 0.7 mg/dL
Alkaline phosphatase 22 U/L
AST 12 U/L
ALT 12 U/L
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've noticed an increasing yellow color in my eyes and skin for the past two days.
Have you had any abdominal pain or discomfort?
No, I haven't had any abdominal pain or discomfort.
Have you had any fever or chills?
I do not have a fever; my temperature is 37.1°C (98.8°F).
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or eating habits?
I'm exclusively breastfed and haven't had any changes in my eating habits.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or sleep quality?
There's no information provided about changes in my sleep patterns or quality.
Have you had any recent exposure to any new substances or environments?
No, I haven't had any recent exposure to new substances or environments.
Have you had any recent travel or changes in your environment?
There's no information provided about recent travel or changes in my environment.
Have you had any recent changes in your medications or supplements?
I haven't taken any medications or supplements; I'm just being breastfed.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or medical history?
My older brother died 3 months after liver surgery.
Final Diagnosis: Jaundice
